1.title: Giving Without Refilling
1.body: Helping others feels natural ‚Äî until your reserves run low. Then giving stops feeling generous and starts feeling heavy.
1.nudge: Block 30 minutes for yourself today. Protect it like you protect others' needs.

bullet.0: You skip meals, sleep, or breaks to be there for someone.
bullet.1: You feel resentment creeping in, but push it down.
bullet.2: You rarely ask for anything back.

2.title: Boundaries You Haven't Drawn
2.body: Sometimes, supporting others means learning when to step back. Saying no doesn't mean you care less ‚Äî it means you last longer.
2.nudge: Say, 'I can help later' instead of 'yes' immediately. Notice how it feels.

bullet.0: You cancel your own plans when someone calls.
bullet.1: You feel guilty about needing personal time.
bullet.2: You can't remember the last time you declined a request.

3.title: The Helper Who Also Needs Help
3.line: Strength is knowing when to lean, too.
3.body: Support givers often forget they're allowed to ask for help. Letting others in doesn't make you less ‚Äî it makes you human.
3.nudge: Share one thing you're struggling with to someone you trust. Let them respond.

bullet.0: You avoid asking to keep from burdening anyone.
bullet.1: You worry people will see you as weak.
bullet.2: You feel relief only in secret when someone steps up for you.

1.title: Escaping in Disguise
1.body: Not all escapes are obvious. You might 'pursue opportunity' or 'seek adventure,' but deep down it's about avoiding the hard thing.
1.nudge: Ask yourself: 'If I couldn't leave or distract myself, what would I have to face?'

cta.label: Tell the truth about your moves ‚Üí

bullet.0: You constantly change focus when things get uncomfortable.
bullet.1: You dive into new hobbies or work to distract from personal issues.
bullet.2: You hide your avoidance behind ambition.

2.title: The High Cost of Constant Motion
2.line: Running drains more than it saves.
2.body: Each escape takes energy ‚Äî packing, planning, adjusting. You leave behind not just problems, but roots, relationships, and growth.
2.nudge: List one thing you've lost from each escape ‚Äî and ask if it was worth the relief.

bullet.1: You miss people or opportunities you left.
bullet.2: You sense you're always in the beginning phase of life.

3.title: Facing Instead of Fleeing
3.line: Freedom comes from resolution, not relocation.
3.body: Sometimes the only way forward is through. Facing discomfort, naming the truth, and choosing to stay can break the loop.
3.nudge: Commit to facing one small discomfort this week without leaving.

0.title: Shoulders That Never Rest
0.line: You've been holding weight for too long.
0.body: Some problems are yours to solve. Others were handed to you because you could 'handle it.' Either way, the load doesn't get lighter just because you're strong.
0.nudge: Write down every problem you're carrying. Circle only the ones that are truly yours to solve.

bullet.0: People share their crises without asking if you're okay.
bullet.1: You work through personal struggles in silence.
bullet.2: You're rarely on the receiving end of help.

1.title: Problems That Aren't Yours
1.body: It's noble to want to protect others, but not every problem needs to live in your arms. Boundaries can be acts of love too.
1.nudge: The next time a problem comes to you, ask: 'What role do you want me to play?' before taking action.

bullet.0: You find yourself solving issues before being asked.
bullet.1: You take on family, friend, or work burdens out of habit.
bullet.2: You feel guilty when you step back.

2.title: The Hidden Weight
2.line: No one sees the full picture.
2.body: When you hide what's heavy, people think you're fine. But invisibility only makes the load heavier.
2.nudge: Tell one person the truth about something you've been downplaying.

bullet.0: You rarely share your deeper struggles.
bullet.2: You believe showing weight will worry others too much.

3.title: Setting It Down Without Guilt
3.body: You don't have to carry everything to prove your strength. Choosing what to carry means you last longer ‚Äî and feel more alive.
3.nudge: Choose one problem to hand off or pause on this week.

bullet.1: You hesitate to hand over responsibilities.
